General course objectives:
General course objectives
This course covers advanced analysis, design, and construction topics related to both concrete and asphalt pavements. Its main objective is to elevate and enrich the knowledge level of the students in order that they could understand the basic assumptions and limitations underlying existing state-of-the-practice methods, and also that they would be able to appreciate and critically evaluate new ideas.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Understand how pavements behave under service conditions
Recognize and explain construction and design parameters that affect performance
Apply layered elasticity theory to analyze mechanical responses in asphalt pavements
Perform inverse analysis of pavement layer properties
Implement linear viscoelastic theory for material characterization
Apply plate theory to analyze mechanical responses in concrete pavements
Classify common concrete pavement distress types
Create pavement mechanics computer codes
